summary: The Esophageal Cancer Awareness Act mandates the Government Accountability Office (GAO) to produce a report evaluating the impact of esophageal cancer on healthcare spending within the Federal Employee Health Benefits Program. The report will assess the total costs and the frequency of esophageal cancer screening among high-risk individuals covered by the program. The bill also highlights the rising incidence and severity of esophageal cancer, emphasizing the need for awareness, early detection, and preventive measures.
